indigenousAnimals.name: Sri Lankan Elephant
indigenousAnimals.description: The Sri Lankan elephant is a subspecies of the Asian elephant and is the largest terrestrial mammal on the island. These elephants are a cultural symbol and can be found in various national parks and protected areas.

indigenousAnimals.name: Sri Lankan Leopard
indigenousAnimals.description: The Sri Lankan leopard is a subspecies of the leopard that is endemic to Sri Lanka. It is one of the apex predators on the island and is primarily found in national parks such as Yala and Wilpattu.

indigenousAnimals.name: Purple-faced Langur
indigenousAnimals.description: Also known as the purple-faced leaf monkey, this primate species is endemic to Sri Lanka. They inhabit the rainforests, especially in places like the Sinharaja Forest Reserve.
